ca.gedge.opgraph.library
Class NodeLibrary

java.lang.Object
  ca.gedge.opgraph.library.NodeLibrary
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<NodeData>
public class NodeLibrary
extends Object
implements Iterable<NodeData>

A class for managing available node classes. Nodes have a corresponding URI, defined as per the following specification:

  • If a node is a Class then its URI will be class://classname, where classname is equal to Class.getName().
  • If a node is a macro, then its URI will be file://parentFile#macroName, where parentFile is equal to File.getName() and macroName is the id of any macro contained in that file.
This type can be used in the register(URI) and get(URI) functions of this class.

Constructor Detail

public NodeLibrary()

Method Detail

register

public NodeData register(URI uri)
                  throws IOException
Attempts to load the node specified by the given type. Type is parsed as per the class' specification. If the type is a macro, and its source file contains multiple macros, all macros in that file will be registered.

Parameters:
uri - the URI to register
Returns:
the node info associated with the newly registered type
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if this library cannot handle the given URI
IOException - if a handler handles the specified URI, but cannot load data from that URI

register

public void register(Class<? extends OpNode> clz)
              throws URISyntaxException
Registers a specified OpNode class to this library.

Parameters:
clz - the class
Throws:
URISyntaxException - if a URI could not be created for the given class

unregister

public NodeData unregister(URI uri)
Unregisters a URI from this library.

Parameters:
uri - the uri to unregister
Returns:
the node info associated with the given uri, or null if the given uri was not registered with this library

put

public void put(NodeData info)
Adds a specific node type to this library.

Parameters:
info - the node info
Throws:
NullPointerException - if given info is null, or any of its members are null
IllegalArgumentException - if no validator exists to handle the URI in the given info

getNodeInfo

public List<NodeData> getNodeInfo()
Gets the node info for every node type registered with this library.

Returns:
a collection of node info

get

public NodeData get(URI uri)
Gets node information associated with a specified type.

Parameters:
uri - the uri of the node
Returns:
the information associated with the given type, or null if the given uri is not registered with this library.
